data.title: Prosecutors say three women assaulted Delta security officer at JFK after being denied boarding
data.description: Prosecutors say three "belligerent" women were indicted for allegedly punching and kicking a Delta security officer at the John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York after being told they would be denied boarding for a flight to Puerto Rico in September of last year.

data.title: BlackRock now manages more than $10 trillion in assets
data.description: The stock market boom has created an insatiable appetite for exchange-traded funds, which make it easy for traders to invest in many of the world's top companies all at once. That's great news for BlackRock, the world's largest money manager.

data.title: These stocks reporting next week usually beat the Street and trade higher
data.description: These companies beat the Street at least 80% of the time and their shares gain at least 0.1% after earnings on average, according to Bespoke data.

data.title: Bill Ford is doubling down on Ford shares, and quietly amassing more control of his grandfather's company in the process
data.description: The decision to purchase the shares bucks a recent trend by CEOs and corporate insiders that have sold a record $69 billion in stock in 2021.

data.title: Sanders, Warren and Baldwin urge Larry Fink to intervene in strike at coal company partially owned by BlackRock
data.description: Sens. Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren and Tammy Baldwin pressed BlackRock CEO Larry Fink to intervene in a coal miners' strike.
